summation_rule: Sum all related GL accounts algebraically (respecting debit/positive and credit/negative signs). Purchases are typically debit balances (positive). Include all purchase-related costs such as freight, custom duty, and other direct purchase expenses. Deduct purchase returns and discounts received.
additional_instructions:
This note captures all purchases of stock-in-trade during the period.

**Purchases of traded goods**: Sum all GL accounts where Ind AS Minor is 'Purchases of traded goods'. This includes:
- Main purchases of goods for resale
- Freight inward/carriage inward on purchases
- Custom duty on imports
- Packaging materials related to purchases
- Any other direct costs attributable to bringing goods to their present location and condition
- Less: Purchase returns (credit entries)
- Less: Discounts received on purchases (credit entries)

Sum algebraically - do not convert negative values to positive. The final amount represents net purchases.

Note: Opening stock and closing stock should NOT be included in this note - they belong to Note 27 (Changes in Inventories).
